author: {'steamid': '76561198183675686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1670070488}
review:
Where am I? Where is the reactor? Where was that place I was at literally 10 seconds ago? What button is rockets again? I'm low on fuel, where are all the fuel tanks?? All I know for sure is that I don't have enough nands...

Heads up; I was playing on the medium difficulty and never experienced nausea, so that may skew my experience from yours.

I just cant recommend this. I spent 3 greuling hours in this game and only made it to level 2. The gameplay elements seem to fight against each other. Why would you make me explore vast empty space when the control scheme is best when in complex indoor spaces? Why do I have to worry about fuel and oxygen when I'm already overwhelmed with not getting lost for the hundredth time? why are there boost rings around when my suit boost works just fine. And also, can I please have a map or hud markers with station names? I don't care about immersing myself in the feeling of being lost in space, there's nothing to do out here but float and die of asphyxiation. 90% of space is like empty space! that's why its called space!

Perhaps there's better gameplay several hours further in, but making progress to that point has been so tedious. Every time I get back to open space I just feel a wave of dread as I have to float around and hope I can read the devs minds and figure out where they want me to go. Probably to whichever grey and white space box is the power relay I guess... 
I hate to leave a bad review, but this game just Isn't there yet.
...soundtrack and graphics are nice tho...

review: This game is awesome and deserves much better than the "mixed" review ratings it has - it really makes you feel like you're an astronaut out in the expanse of space! It simulates a zero g environment which makes the controls difficult to learn and make it very easy to lose control - BUT - once you learn them, moving through the environment becomes easy(ish). Sadly this game isn't for everyone though. If you are even a little susceptible to motion sickness, this game will get you sick within minutes. I consider myself immune to motion sickness and even I got a slight headache after an hour or so - I had to play in hour long blocks. I really do wish there were more games like this, it's a fantastic experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034145229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1644311820}
review:
It's unplayable with the latest HP Reverb G2 WMR controllers. The new WMR controllers don't include trackpads so it may work if someone skilled enough knows how to remap it properly. I was able to play it as intended with the original WMR controllers which do include the trackpad but the new ones are a no go! With that said, it works with the HP Reverb G2 but remapping is required or the original WMR controllers are needed. 

Once you get pass this issue, it's a pretty good VR experience. I've only played it a few minutes but the controls are extremely touch sensitive. Surprisingly, I didn't get dizzy when I lost thrust control and began to spin like a lunatic .. lol  The game has a mechanism that closes the viewing perspective to help you avoid getting nauseated as you rotate ect ..

Looks like it's a fun title to play but it will test your patience. I recommend it but don't get this if you get frustrated easily. Take it easy, do the tutorial, learn the controls and it will be much more enjoyable.

One more thing, disable tutorial in menu options once you are done with it. Afterwards, select New Game followed by Arcade if you want to make it slightly easier on yourself. If you leave the tutorial option on you will get thrown back into it after you complete it and try to continue the game.

review:
So far, as an experienced VR player, with no motion sickness, I could only play this game for around an hour straight without having to take a break. I used the arcade difficulty which makes braking and controlling your movement easier, and it still isnt easy. You are non-stop struggling to control your momentum and not smash head first into that asteroid.

But it is fun, and if you're looking for a VERY ADVANCED physics based zero gravity game with very simple puzzles, there isn't much else like it. 

Also, I used the flight controls, they were easiest for me. They offer 3 different control schemes, including a simple point and move system, which i found to be too easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997471856', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1643116333}
review:
While it can be a bit frustrating, lacking tools to find things you might need at times (hunting through a debris field for power nodes, and then running low on oxygen on fuel which you also then have to hunt for - a radar, or a known source for the latter two that you can return to would make a world of difference) this is nontheless stunning short experience.
It takes a while to get used to the controls, but once you have done so, flying in zero gravity feels /almost/ strightforward.
Both reactor scenes are a little awkward, but the rest of the experience was quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139344280', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1639612500}
review:
[h2]Weltraumausflug mit [i]H√∂hen[/i] und [i]Tiefen[/i][/h2]
Detached ist ein schwieriger Fall. Mit seinen grundlegenden Mechaniken macht es vieles richtig, denn wenn man sich mal an eine der Steuerungsmethoden und die Besonderheiten der Schwerelosigkeit gew√∂hnt hat, kann sich die Bewegung durch das All ziemlich elegant und gut anf√ºhlen. 
Das Spiel kommt dabei jedoch nicht an die Klasse eines Lone Echo heran, was unter anderem daran liegt, dass wir in Detached keine nutzbaren H√§nde besitzen. Das bedeutet: Kein Absto√üen von Objekten, kein Entlanghangeln an Gel√§ndern und generell ein weniger interaktives All. Im Rahmen dieser Grenzen funktioniert die Bewegung aber immer noch gut. Auch ohne virtuelle H√§nde wird neben dem Gamepad das Handtracking von VR-Controllern unterst√ºtzt. So erlaubt es eines der Steuerung-Setups, mit der Bewegung des rechten Controllers im Raum Momentum aufzubauen, um uns im Spiel in alle Richtungen zu drehen. Ich habe mit Oculus Touch gespielt.

Haben wir die gew√ºnschte Position erreicht, k√∂nnen wir diese durch Tastendruck fixieren - zumindest auf der mittleren der drei Komfortstufen. 
Auf niedrigstem Komfortniveau m√ºssen wir mit den Schubd√ºsen das Momentum wohl manuell ausgleichen, w√§hrend bei "h√∂chstem" Komfort gar kein Momentum √ºber die Zeitspanne des Schwungholens aufkommt. Ich kann nur empfehlen, sich Zeit zu nehmen, um zu Spielbeginn im Tutorialraum ein bisschen mit den Einstellungen zu experimentieren. Mit meinem anfangs gew√§hlten Setup kam ich zum Beispiel gar nicht klar, wohingegen oben erw√§hnte Einstellungen f√ºr mich sehr gut funktioniert haben.

[b]Die Nadeln im Sternhaufen[/b]
Um in die Kampagne starten zu k√∂nnen, m√ºssen wir erstmal in den Optionen das Tutorial deaktivieren - eine der nicht ganz seltenen Momente, in denen sich Detached etwas holprig anf√ºhlt. Wurde diese H√ºrde √ºberwunden, erz√§hlt uns das Spiel eine schmale Geschichte von zwei Abenteurern, die in einem abgelegenen und aufgegebenen System auf der Suche nach wertvollen Hinterlassenschaften der Abbaufirmen sind. Dann geht das Schiff zu Bruch, wir werden von unserem Partner getrennt und m√ºssen Ma√ünahmen einleiten, um uns aus unserer misslichen Lage zu befreien.
Gro√üteils bedeutet das, in einem Wirrwarr von Tr√ºmmern und Gestein Geb√§ude ausfindig zu machen, in denen Systeme hochgefahren werden m√ºssen. Aufgabenmarkierungen gibt es nur in ausgew√§hlten F√§llen w√§hrend Missionen, aber nicht bei der freien Erkundung. Das macht die Suche nach den Zielen im Weltraum, in dem es bekanntlich kein Oben und Unten gibt, nicht gerade einfach. Doch noch besser: Oft braucht es im All verstreute Nands, die wie Batterien in die Systeme eingesetzt werden und nat√ºrlich nochmal deutlich kleiner ausfallen als die Geb√§ude. 
Wir finden auch Sauerstoff und Treibstoff, denn das geht uns nach einer Weile beides aus. Zumindest ersterer wurde einige Male knapp, wenn ich das All mal wieder akribisch nach einem verbleibenden Nand abgrasen musste. Oder als ich einmal scheinbar √ºber die Levelgrenze geschwebt bin und ohne Vorwarnung in Sekundenschnelle meinen komplette Luft ausgesaugt bekommen habe.   

Das klingt frustrierend und so war es regelm√§√üig auch - gerade, weil die Checkpoints rar und teils komisch gesetzt sind. Doch da sich die Bewegung durch das All gut angef√ºhlt hat, habe ich die Herausforderung angenommen und die Erfolgserlebnisse waren es dann doch wert. 
Dazu gibt es abseits des erw√§hnten Suchfokuses auch noch eine solide Anzahl an Umgebungsr√§tseln und Action-Sequenzen, die gerne unsere K√∂rperphysik einbeziehen und Gebrauch vom in den Anzug verbauten Schild, Raketenwerfer sowie Geschwindigkeitsboost machen. Diese Sequenzen finden oft in engen Innenr√§umen statt und sorgen f√ºr einen willkommenen Pacing- und Gameplaywechsel. Teilweise sind sie aber ziemlich schwer und erfordern es, sich richtig gut mit dem Bewegungssystem zurechtzufinden. Jep, damit steht und f√§llt in Detached echt alles!

[b]Losgel√∂st im All[/b]
Nochmal kurz zur√ºck zur Story: Wo der Beginn noch ganz nett inszeniert ist, scheint den Entwicklern in dieser Hinsicht schnell das Geld und/oder die Lust ausgegangen zu sein. Dialoge sind sp√§rlich und das Writing teilweise schrecklich. Dazu fallen Erkl√§rungen zum aktuellen Geschehen so mangelhaft aus, dass ich gegen Ende der etwa f√ºnfst√ºndigen Kampagne gar nicht mehr wusste, was hier eigentlich geschieht. Naja, holprig.
Technisch macht Detached einen runderen Eindruck. Wo es an Effekten mangelt, sieht das Spiel trotz im Detail etwas sterilen Objekten immer noch stimmungsvoll aus. Gerade die Weltraumpanoramen mit ihrem schicken Licht und der gekonnt zusammengestellten Collage an Weltraumschrott und Felsen k√∂nnen beeindrucken. Unterlegt wird das von einem tollen Soundtrack von Mikolai Stroinski, der auch an den OSTs von The Witcher 3 und The Vanishing of Ethan Carter beteiligt war.

Detached verf√ºgt auch √ºber einen 1vs1-Multiplayer mit verschiedenen Modi. Ohne Absprache d√ºrfte die Spielsuche aber schwierig werden. Ich habe den Multiplayer nicht wirklich ausprobiert. Viel Langzeitmotivation konnte ich hier auch nicht erkennen.

[i]Pers√∂nliches Rating:[/i] [b]69[/b]/100

[i]Fazit[/i]
[h3]Wer ein passendes Setup f√ºr die Steuerung von Detached findet, kann aus diesem teils unn√∂tig unzug√§nglichen VR-Abenteuer eine lohnenswerte Erfahrung bekommen. Frustresistenz, Durchhalteverm√∂gen und Spa√ü an kosmischen Ostereiersuchen sind allerdings wichtige Anforderungen f√ºr diesen Astronautenschein.[/h3]

[i]Wenn dir mein Review gefallen hat, freue ich mich √ºber eine Bewertung.[/i]

review: Boring. It completely lacks any features that make a VR game worth playing; there's no free head movement, room-scale locomotion (I suppose it gets a pass for this one because you're mostly EVAing in a space suit), arm or hand movement, meaningful environmental activity, and it has little value as an atmospheric experience. author: {'steamid': '76561198071170428', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1618286656}
review:
This game doesn't feel like a VR game, it feels like a terrible port of a normal game.

I don't think anyone likes how this game controls, you're basically strapped to a chair with your head braced. You can't move your arms, you can't move your head, you can't even walk around.

The controls are unintuitive, you use your head to interact with objects and the hand controllers are useless other than pressing the interact button or turning and thrusting towards locations.

It's absolute garbage, it feels horrible to play. Let me look around, let me have hands. Those two things would probably make reviews positive since lacking them makes the game feel unplayable with how terrible everything feels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1630299711}
review:
[h1]Experienced on the Oculus Quest 2[/h1]

You can view my review & gameplay here: https://youtu.be/-8hQrJJeNKg

Detached is a zero-gravity space simulation game. It is hard-core. I quit playing this game about halfway through (I watched a full walkthrough). It's not a bad game per se, but it definitely has some negatives you have to overlook to enjoy this experience. 

The biggest negative is the control scheme(s). None of the different control methods felt good. You need to spend time in the game to get used to them. Even then, it feels like you're fighting the controls and it adds an artificial difficulty to the experience. The other big negative is the core gameplay loop. You're basically looking for tiny objects scattered around in the vastness of space all while having to keep an eye on your oxygen and fuel levels. If you take a wrong turn, you're almost certainly die. The problem is that you never know exactly where you're supposed to be going, except through trial and error. The game has random checkpoints, some that feel generous and others that feel punishing.

I really wanted to complete this game. It has gorgeous visuals. When you first look out and see all the space debris in the vastness of space, it is jaw-dropping. It also has several sections that are fun & challenging to play. I could imagine with a better control scheme it being very fun to navigate these "courses." Unfortunately, it isn't fun to have to re-do large sections of the game over and over until you master the controls.

Game is running on the Unreal Engine. On my RTX 3080, on high graphical settings and pixel density set at about 192, I was getting almost steady 90 fps with only a few drops / stutters here and there. Unfortunately, I did find that using motion controllers on the Oculus Quest 2 was not feasible. I had difficulties selecting menu items with my Touch controllers, so much so that I had to use an Xbox gamepad. I also found manuevering was much better using a gamepad. 

Game is beautiful, challenging, & has a great musical soundtrack. However, the controls & core gameplay loop kept me from wanting to continue playing this game. That's a shame, because there are epic moments in this game. 

[b]Rate 6/10. Buy on sale recommendation only.[/b]

[quote]If you enjoyed my review, please consider joining my Steam Curator Group. You can join here: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Oculus_WMR [/quote]

review:

review:
Space is cool.
Learning to navigate space (despite not having the use of VR arms or free look) is cool.

What is [i]not[/i] cool is trying to locate the required battery boxes. They are only 1 meter cubes floating in a debris field several cubic blocks large. Why this space future doesn't have some sort of object radar I can't fathom.

The game looks great and sounds nice (tho drone sound design could be improved). But the [i]only[/i] thing you do is traverse space. 

And because the gameplay loop is so simple, any annoyances only get amplified.
So I cannot recommend this product.
developer_response: We hear you. Shame you've went with negative review because of that one reason, but if there's anything we can do to make it better - please tell us :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969099630', 'num_games_owned': 1280, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1619639835}
review:
Rating based on $1 on Humble Bundle 26/04/2021. Otherwise I would have thumbed down. 
This is could be a Unreal Engine tech demo.  For a game based on movement and reaching places my 30 minutes was not fun at all. 
* Tunnel vision when moving is also ridiculous, you can only view when you are stationary. 
* Movement and control mostly in a straight line, frustrating.  No consideration for fun/realism balance.
* FOV Field Of View is restricted due to your head inside a visor. Cosmonauts on the ISS international Space Station has better FOV. 
* Movement consumes fuel. Point at a destination and give thrust, then correct your suit orientatation when moving. Consume fuel. Deal with tunnel vision and limited FOV during movement. FOV much less than  your VR headset.  I spent most of my 30 minutes searching for fuel and oxygen while trying to steer the space suit. Spending one hour mastering the controls may be fun in a flight sim, not here.
* Games are supposed to  be games first, balanced with realism. I can understand that there are people that would favor realism first, but is FUN?
* My 30 minutes was not fun, mainly consisted of searching for fuel and oxygen as it runs out too fast. Just as you get going struggling to master control movement a warning about oxygen depletetion sounds.
* Graphics: Beautiful, especially outside the station. The asteroids, planet rings. Easily one of the most beautiful looking VR games.  Unfortunately no fun to be had. It's a tech demo.
* Music atmospheric chilled space music just so happens what I listen to myself. Sound is minimal but there is to hear is good.  Many people forget importantance of good sound design because it can not be seen. Unconsiously sound has a huge influence. I rate excellent sound design above visuals.

Headset: Quest 2 with Virtual Desktop.
developer_response: Hello :) Thanks for a positive review! The tunnel vision can be turned off [eagle eye view/blinders], and as for the movement, we will be releasing a new patch this month with fixes and valve index support.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964466717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1619400833}
review:
Overall: There's fun to be had. I liked what I played, but lots of flaws. Needs more varied motion sickness reduction options front and centre. Recommend at a heavy discount, for those who have some motion sickness tolerance.

Motion sickness
I'm pretty well practised with VR with over 200 hours logged, but the medium level simulation level was nauseating. 
Especially bad when you have a collision - which are not completely avoidable during a playthrough. It does state that it may cause nausea, but I wasn't expecting to get fully, rapidly spun around. That needs its own whole option in my opinion. Moving the player's view without their control is basically number 1 on the VR Don'ts list.
Also on medium control once you initiate a spin it doesn't stop until you hit brakes. There is FOV narrowing, but it was not strong enough for me to avoid some sickness. I didn't see a control for that, it should be presented at starting a new game.
I believe "Arcade" (the 'easy') mode is globally easier to control and has less unintended spin, but I haven't tried it yet. There is also a harder simulation mode, which I haven't tried.

Main menu only accepts input from one controller, and wasn't even showing my pointer until I randomly jabbed some buttons. 
Tutorials don't actually cover all the controls. "Use activate" it says when you're looking at a panel. OK? 
Then the modules you pick up you never get button prompts for those either. You're simply expected to know.

The lack of direction was worrying. The layout is pretty well designed; You go to the next place you can see, and you're going to the right way. Except you can see accelerators and they're *not* the right way until specific events. I have to assume that if you get off course, it could be very difficult to get back to the right place. I couldn't tell which locations that had been completed at a glance.
developer_response: Whoa, that's a pretty detailed review! A lot to dig into by our designers. Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170206754', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1618890671}
review:
If you're wondering if you should buy this and want a short answer, no. For $25 you can get several boxes of Twix candy bars, those will provide you with MUCH more fun and satisfaction then this ever could.

It's a novel idea, but the game really isn't setup right for use with motion controllers. I'm constantly trying to reach out for objects to grab them, but you don't have any arms, so you have to stick to looking at things and pressing buttons as an "alternative". It feels like it was made for an Xbox Controller, given that all it uses is the gyroscope and the buttons on it. 

It missed out on so much, like instead of having thrusters, grabbing onto objects and flinging yourself for movement, or grabbing small items and interacting with them with no gravity would be awesome, but alas that will never happen. 

I'm happy I got this for $1 on Humble Bundle, because I wouldn't pay anything more for it. If I could actually use the motion controllers for what they're intended to be used for, I may consider picking this back up and playing through it more.

Tl-Dr: Over glorified VR demo which gets old after about 15 minutes
developer_response:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/917720/Gamedec/

author: {'steamid': '76561198015829251', 'num_games_owned': 1234, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1618511866}
review:
I managed to set up decent controls (overall, I feel the realistic rotation is kind of a bother so I went with arcade mode) so that wasn't a problem.

What I disliked is that this is a game about exploration... But everything is just so samey, at least on the first level. You mostly interact with the similar looking panels over and over that do stuff - but all interiors look the same, and even the exteriors can be hard to tell apart (since you will be approaching them from different angles)

Then there is sort of a sort of short action sequence right afterwards... but beating it gives more of a sense of relief than exhilaration. Also invisible walls unless you go down the route they want you to in this sequence (maybe more realistic flight modes can't get there)


I gave up in a sequence when you have to go on yet another fetch quest that triggers and action scene, but the section resets at the start of the fetch quest rather than the action scene. I was not even particularly long but I couldn't be bothered to continue
developer_response: Sorry to hear that, I will pass your feedback to our designers so we can do better with our next projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066776839', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1618542823}
review:
I'm good with VR, but this made me sick.

I love the premise for this game, but the controls just don't make any sense for a VR game. It feels like it was meant for controllers and VR controls were tacked on. That, or it's just a 4-year-old game that was already using outdated VR controls. You don't move and traverse and even look around at all like you'd expect, which leads to a lot of motion sickness.
developer_response:
Hello, have you tried different movement options? There are some modifiers available in the options menu. 

As for the movement: it is accurate to the actions a real astronaut is having while in his suit. They use thrusters to maneuver and rotate, and their head-movement doesn't affect the direction they're heading. So yeah, that was a design choice, since that was (what we feel) accurate.

review:
Malgr√© une ambiance plut√¥t sympa Detached rate le coche et n'est pas un jeu VR tr√®s engageant... en fait ce n'est pas un jeu tr√®s engageant, l'aspect VR √©tant encore le plus sympa. 

Le jeu semble alterner entre exploration/puzzle et moments "action" et dans les deux cas cela tombe √† plat. L'aspect explo est assez p√©nible car l'interface n'indique pas o√π aller, ni ne propose m√™me de journal pour lire l'objectif en cours, ce qui serait ok si le level design suivait. Ce n'est malheureusement pas le cas et du coup on erre un peu au hasard le temps de trouver o√π est l'endroit o√π l'objectif souhait√© ; √ßa reste ok car c'est joli et que les contr√¥les au touchpad sont funs, mais bon... Quant aux moments un peu plus action, cela est dysfonctionnel aussi car le reste du jeu ne pr√©pare pas √† ces m√©caniques donc c'est du die & retry, cassant alors pas mal l'ambiance. 

[EDIT : ce paragraphe concerne un point qui peut √™tre apparemment d√©sactiv√© (voir commentaire du dev, m√™me si je n'ai pas trouv√© quand j'ai cherch√© lors de mes sessions] Autre d√©tail √©trange, quand on fait une rotation, le champ visuel se resserre √©norm√©ment, comme si on subissait un voile noir. D√©j√† cela brise un peu l'immersion et le fait de profiter de la mise en sc√®ne, et c'est particuli√®rement lourd quand on cherche quelque chose... ce qui constitue une grosse portion du jeu comme indiqu√© ci-dessus. 

L'histoire est sans int√©r√™t donc m√™me √ßa n'est pas bien motivant.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982856872', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1618086040}
review:
The game detected the Index controllers, and tracked their movement, but kept telling me I needed to connect a controller to continue. So I tried playing with keyboard, but the key mapping is terrible and you can't change it. So I tried playing with an xbox controller, and control was just very clunky anyway because it requires constant use of both sticks, the triggers, the bumpers, and pushing in on a stick just for the most basic navigation. Movement is very slow and just sucks out the potential for fun.

The game assumes everyone gets easily motion-sick, so every time you move it gives you super narrow tunnel vision with a black ring that jerks in and out to block all but the very center of your vision. You can't see what's going on to navigate around, and you can't adjust or turn off this "feature" in any setting I could find.

The helmet you're inside of is giant and doesn't track with your head, more like a claustrophobic spaceship cockpit. I found that it wouldn't stay straight so I was always looking out the wrong way. The game's HUD is on the glass right in front of you, so you'll be crossing your eyes to try and read the text that pops up five inches from your face. It would have been so easy to make it look just as if I had a holographic display in my helmet, I mean that's what VR is in the first place.

I didn't make it very far into the game to find out if the story gets uh, more engaging than the beginning. But it just wasn't playable with the controls and graphical choices the designers made.
developer_response: Hello, you can turn of most of the things that annoyed you in the game settings. Bird-view/vignette/blinders is what you were looking for in terms of the limiting vision/reduce motion sickness stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081103893', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1630597996}
review:
Game is ALL about the movement.  If you get sick easy I guess don't play but you should know better honestly at this point.  You expect to spin around in space with NO problems no amount of computer code is gonna prevent that.  There are fisheye options you can turn on.

For the rest the best experience is turn all that crap off and learn the simulation movement style.  Once you get it down it's great.  Blows me away though the reviews.  Got the gogogogo generation dumbfounded how they have to TAKE TIME TO LEARN THE CONTROLS!!!!  As in YOU have to learn how to play the game before you are good at it.  OMG!  Whodda thunk it?  Typical.  It's a fun ride and it does exactly what it says on the tin.  Read the description.  It doesn't advertise an amazing tale.  You must get to safety in space.  

IMO best way played as mentioned by others is to sit in a chair (with armrests preferably).  I like to use the controls like you are sitting in an EVA chair.  Don't know exact name but I remember seeing them being used by the shuttle astronauts before.  Just a chair with control joysticks and thruster packs.

I love it.  Really immersive and looks great.
developer_response:
Glad you had a great time! Thanks for appreciating our attention to detail. We had great fun trying to simulate the zero-g movement :)

Just for curiosity - what hardware you've been using?

review:

you are enclosed inside a suit that does not move... if you want to look around you have to use the controls to spin and go forwards, because the helmet does not move... the sense of vertigo or everything the game trailer promises is just not there. it is better to play a free vr game of rollercoasters than this game. author: {'steamid': '76561198024964123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1589526963}
review:
Played with Vive Pro

The developers saw Adrift and wanted to add guns, more oxygen, and more boost so that you're not a floating,desperate Steven Hawkings in space. The graphics are good and I like the controls. I did not get nauseous playing the game. When you rotate, the game limits your view angle which is nice. I can't say this for Adrift.

The issue I have is that the tutorial needs to be more clear about the controls somehow. I'm not sure how but I didn't initially understand that the left controller is to move, while the right is for rotation. Also didn't realize that you have to push the Track pad on the right controller. I actually stopped playing this for a while because I wasn't patient enough to figure things out for myself. The game doesn't hold your hand enough. Speaking of that, I also don't know where I'm supposed to go for mission objectives, I'm having to guess which kills the fun. 

Still, I like the game despite it's flaws. I'm glad I got this on sale despite the Mixed review rating.
developer_response:
Great review, n00n3h3r3! We really appreciate your honesty. Our team is looking into the tutorial, and your feedback is very helpful.

We're happy you liked the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018124881', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1588506140}
review:
I'm not sure if I should post a positive or negative review for this game. It seems like solid game, just not built for VR experience.

Pros:
This game gives a solid 'man in space' feel (as long as you do not look inside man made structures). Overal atmosphere is solid.

Cons:
1. Movement. You can't push yourself of surfaces, you can't use environment to decelerate, you can't attach yourself to surfaces. I might have a relatively high 'VR in space' movement standards, but I feel like these ones are definition of what movement in space should be like.
2. VR games in general tend to favor interactions with environment, in this game there are no VR-like interactions. You see container with oxygen - you look at it and press 'A', it just changes color to dark and your tank indicates that it got more gas. Items that you pick up with 'A' just disapear. You click on a panel and item appears. There are no on-screen buttons. Lack of interaction is notiecable and immersion breaking.
3. Controls. These are not controls for VR spacesuit, but controls made for keyboard and mouse that were mapped to controllers. While I agree with overal control type (you need to engage thrusters to rotate or move), I think controls (at least for oculus controllers) could have been done better.
4. Environment. Most structures do not give a feel of something made for space and do not add properly to environment. Lots of unused surfaces, bare walls and ceilings, most things are uselesly huge (I understand that spacesuit is large and need large passages, but not everything). Not enough 'fillers' be that toilets, tables, suit locker, equipment or whatewer else. Example: the most defining feature of airlock are two large screen (one with vent below) and how bare it is: no railings, no places to lock cargo, no ports where suits were supposed to connect their safeties or life support, no override ports or notiecable access hatches.
developer_response: Hi andreykl, thank you for your valid feedback. Detached was made for VR three years ago, and we appreciate that you took the time to write this detailed review. We will take your opinion into consideration while we focus on Gamedec - our newest project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006298035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1588337756}
review:
The game would be certainly good if it didn't pretend to be built for VR.
Controls are really a pain, and just breaks the immersion.
While you can turn your head around, all you can see is your helmet's inside, just must use only the direction of your hands to move.

My feeling is that the game was developed for standard gaming, and ported last minute on VR to sell more copies.
developer_response: Hello Falken, Detached was made to be a VR title - sorry to hear that you're not a fan of the solutions we picked for camera movements. Maybe our newest title [non-vr], Gamedec, will interest you more?

author: {'steamid': '76561198039600689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1619010371}
review:
It's a really good game showing what VR is capable of and what allows us to play in Virtual Reality.

The feeling of being an engineer in space and the need to save yourself in the form of environmental puzzles in space is pure pleasure.

The ability to move in all directions allows you to experience the possibilities of VR in a new way, maneuvering in space and simple interactions are a really cool element of gameplay.

I highly recommend it, it was a really enjoyable experience.

Played on Oculus Quest with Link.
developer_response: Thanks, Zick! Glad you liked it!  Check out our other games! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198033310641', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1589393640}
review:
Just played it for 30 minutes so far but I can recommend this Game, maybe not for the full price.
It really gets me feeling strange and like in zero-gravity (not that I ever was in zero-gravity in my life, but this is how I would imagine it. ;)

I would not recommend it for people who get motion sick quick, but if you are already used to VR, this will make you feel very strange in a nice way.
The gameplay itself is nothing special, go there, open this, collect that, but the graphics, the controls (in simulation mode) and the immersion this game offers is really a cool little experience.

I just miss that I can use my physical hands ingame. Would be cool to see them at least.
developer_response: Hello Mizzu, thank you for your feedback, we will pass it to the team.  We're very happy you like our game and appreciate the graphics and playstyle :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198102746011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1579875079}
review:
At first I wasn't sure if I want it, but it was on a -75% sale so why not. There are not so many sci-fi games that might interest me, but I recently watched a movie "Gravity", and Detached looked promising.

It looks gorgeous, the steering is a bit clumsy, but it's worth mastering. Some people might whine about not having fuel or oxygen, but I don't think they're hard to spot and collect.

All in all I had a great fun, and I think I'll come back for more in a couple of days.

review: This game is demanding - that's for sure. But rewarding as well. I've never felt so intimidated by Space and being in zero gravity before... and I like it. review: This game feels so pointless. The controls and zero gravity thing is cool, but very frustrating to use. The "objectives" of the game are pointless errand like missions (go here, click this, go there, click that) with no depth whatsoever, there is just a guy that talk to you every so often without helping you. author: {'steamid': '76561198188894641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1578718560}
review:
Well, this game successfully pushed my patience to the limits. It works good and looks good but I didn't find much enjoyment in it. There's a lot of backtracking, getting lost, disorientation and general frustration. Judging by the steam achievements, most people might have liked playing it and weren't committed to finishing it through to the end. I noticed in a walkthrough after I finished that the playstation version offers guidance at certain spots that simply weren't obvious in the PC version, leaving me stranded. Sometimes there's objective markers, sometimes there's not. The game kinda throws you to the wolves and by the time you've adapted to gathering mission items and navigating death traps, it's over. Glad I played it but I won't ever look back.
-played on vive cosmos
developer_response: Hi Your Digital Companion, thank you for your honest review. We understand that some people might have find navigation a little bit troubling. Right now there are no plans to implement additional features to the game, but we will take your comments into considerations while designing new games, as we do with Gamedec right now :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198302046117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1578582274}
review:
Game is challenging but come on - space is challenging as well :) 

Cannot endorse complaints about controls - they are quite natural once you understand you are in space and you have more DoF than on the ground. 

As for nausea - I have an iron stomach so it was not a problem for me but you have been warned - never make a twist while moving forward :)

I also like slow-paced games so I could simply enjoy the beauty of the space however I can understand the disappointment of action-hungry players. Yes, it is more a sim than a game but I do not find it as a disadvantage.

TL;DR - good sim for space lovers which like an exploration without excessive haste.
developer_response: Thank you, gdc, for this precise and nicely focus review. As we can see, you are a true fan of the genre. We are delighted to see that we have managed to satisfy your hunger for space travel. We hope that you will spend many more pleasant moments with Detached!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987485219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1577774077}
review:
I've beaten the game and I cannot recommend it in its current state, but it's close to being quite good.
Pros:
-Good graphics
-Great music!
-Good puzzle solving elements.

Cons:
-Poor controls: I played with Arcade controls (which is supposedly easier) and it's frustrating how loose the controls are. I understand it's suppose to simulate being in space, but when there are timed puzzles where you have to navigate through tight corridors, you end up bumping into objects and overshooting your targets a LOT.
-Lack of checkpoints: There is a part where you have to collect energy cells in space and escort a companion's escape pod, where if you die for whatever reason (i.e. killed by drone or run out of oxygen), then you'll have to repeat the fetch quest from scratch, which is super time consuming. As well, there's a timed reactor core mission where if you die, you have to repeat parts of the fetch quest, which is frustrating. About half of my play time is in this area...
-Lack of objective pointers: It's so easy to get disoriented and miss collecting a mission objective, which leads to a lot of back tracking.

Overall, I cannot recommend this game unless it goes on sale or if the developers fix these issues.
developer_response: Hello Legion_Nintendo, thank you for your honest review. Right now there are no plans to alter the code for Detached - we're focusing on developing Gamedec, our new game. We're sorry you felt that the controls were still sloppy, but the feedback about checkpoints and objective pointers are very helpful and we will have this in mind while working on new titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132315022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1577482490}
review: If you like having a limited view and standing still in your VR games, the game is for you. The game play does look promising, however my biggest issue with this game is the HUD size, and the motion sickness. I got a bad headache very quick with this game. HUD takes up about 65% of your view. this wouldn't be an issue normally, however this game also lacks the ability to use your own physical motion to change perspective (for the most part), which is a huge down side. If these features are added or changed I'd likely give this game another chance, not just yet tho. If you buy the game I hope you have a much better experience then I did.
developer_response: Hello Dr.Reaper, thank you for your feedback. Motion sickness is a significant issue we were facing - for some people, playing with arcade-style controls [in the menu], helped to prevent this feeling. Right now, we're focused on developing our new games, so there are no plans to alter Detached at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271090095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1576839919}
review: Would recommend it only for people that like to stand still in vr
developer_response: Hello, the game was designed to be a sit-down game. When in space, an astronaut is moving using his thrusters, not muscles, so sitting down had more sense for us. It's also user-friendly for people with many disabilities - we didn't want to exclude players from experiencing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014920311', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1576436682}
review:
Wanted to love this game, and feel the wonder of being out in open space.

Although there is definitely some wonder there the game's controls, graphics and most of all it's tasks let it down. I came out thinking I had been playing for 2+ hours yet it had been around 50 minutes. And, to me, that's definitely not a feeling you should have especially when interacting with such a special environment in VR.

The concept was there but execution was poor, and a couple of elements even seemed wholly unfinished; I found a monitor which read "TITLE TITLE TITLE" and below "DESCRIPTION DESCRIPTION DESCRIPTION", even for a game on sale for ¬£5 I think that's particularly sloppy. And it was right in the first area!!

Overall worth a try for the gimmick but only if it were free.
developer_response:
Hello yurboi bangs, thank you for your honest review. We're sorry if the title didn't meet your expectations in terms of graphics and controls. We've added arcade style controls to help players with movement and interactions - did you try this mode?

About the monitor - we've passed it to our team, but first of all - congratulations on your keen eye! We're 100% sure our QA team did their best in terms of bug tracking etc, but things like that might happen no matter how many people develop the game.

All in all - we're happy you gave Detached a shot and decided to share your thoughts. A feedback like this helps us make future games better!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987869334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1573798752}
review: Overall I think this was a good game.  While there are a few segments that are very frustrating, it's good.  The Graphics and Physics are really well done.  If you like Adrift, it will have a similar feel Except without the breadcrumbs (Which is the frustrating part).  There aren't a lot of clues to figure out where to go next ,and definitely don't go filling up oxygen when you don't need it.  The biggest frustration is the auto saves in the space sequence are far and in between which is where it can get frustrating if you are almost completed with a sequence and then you end up dying.  But that is what makes it part of the challenge and a longer game for that.  Completed in about 6-7 hours.  Overall I'd recommend it,  Its not Lone Echo by any means, but a good game overall.
developer_response:
Hello and thank you for your kind words. We really liked this review - it's honest, straightforward and we think it will clear up the situation for people who still don't know if it's worth to try.

Once again - thank you for your time and we're happy you liked Detached :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198038118439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1572385585}
review:
It was an interesting experience but it's hard to recommend this in the current form.
Overall there is not much happening in this game, but that's ok if you can get it for a discount.
The first hour or so was pretty interesting hovering around like some sort of drone and progressively getting better with controlling my manoeuvres (was using xbox controller).
But then, half way through the game,  a time restricted race must be completed while blowing up stuff along the way. It's tedious, annoying, frustrating and boring and after 3 fails I am not going to attempt this again.
So, half of the game remains unplayed, therefore I would only recommend buying this when the price drops to something like 25% of the full price.
Tip: reduce the eagle eye option to see more while rotating and don't use arcade mode, with arcade controls you are missing out on the only interesting thing there is in this game.
developer_response: Hi! Thank you for this honest review. We understand that the "race" part might be hard to complete - especially with the non-arcade control. "Fun factor & challenge" balance is important. It's something we will definitely have in mind while designing our next games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971204296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1711143136}
review:
I'm not sure if I'll be playing this game all the way through, but wanted to report if you want to see what all the fuss was about concerning Issac Newton and his laws of motion, you'll experience them first hand if you play in simulation mode.

As some people have said it's possible to get motion sickness, but just take your time. Go slow. Use the brakes. 

If you liked the movie "gravity" (Sandra Bullock), you can experience it for yourself!
developer_response:
Hi! Thanks for your honest review! Gravity may be the best comparison - we wanted to make in-Space movement and create isolation & fear atmosphere very close to the actual emotions you might experience during space walks.

We're glad you've enjoyed the game! :)

review: Wow! Just played 76 mins straight in simulation mode after buying this game... a true test of your VR legs! I lost concentration on the controls for a few moments, nearly fell over and felt a little queasy so decided to sit down... at that moment the game decided to crash, so I took that as a sign to stop and continue tomorrow, but yeah, really awesome stuff when you get the hang of the controls and if you can stomach it! I did the tutorial initially in Arcade mode, which was much gentler on the rotations. If, like me, you hate the vignette movement comfort thing, you can adjust / disable it in the menu with a slider.... it took me a while to find it as they call it "Eagle eye" (or something like that). Visually very beautiful and felt extremely immersive in the Pimax 5k+.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961621492', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1562084171}
review:
This game does not deserve your dollars. 

A lot of the criticism left on this game is valid, yet the users own fault. 
I thoroughly believe that the developer made the controls difficult on purpose, which is honestly fine. 
What I don't enjoy is the steep difficulty curve, Im pretty adept in VR spacegames and quickly got a handle of the controls. I experienced no discomfort with moving around, even quickly. But the first 'real' mission is a race where you have to hit 3 or 4 points within 3 minutes. Retried this 4 times, but there isn't enough time on the clock to finish it at "first, second, third or fourth retry" 

I was willing to give it a chance, at the price (summer sale), but this game suffers from serious bad pacing and the "game" part of the game simply dissolved for me. 
Space is hard, this game is hard. But a little leeway would have been nice. As it is, I won't ever play this title again even after putting it down twice to rethink my tactics. Ask your self, how many times would you feel forced to put down a game, yet still come back to it? for me that limit is 3 times.
developer_response:
Hi,

Thanks for your honest review. I will strict to the issue with the objective related to disabling satellites. 

Space is hard, and we decided not to guide players all the time. But, the location of the specific parts and upcoming objectives are placed in the position that can suggest players how to pass the space station in the best way possible (+ in the middle of the HUD you can see a small arrow that's navigating you). Of course, you can do it in your way, no problem with that! But for the specific tasks, you need advanced features of the EVA Suit like rockets, boost and shield. 

I assume that you unlocked the rocket module, but to pass this section without problems, you need speed module too. Check out the following guide on Steam, to get familiar with the environment, where you can find these modules. I can guarantee that you can pass this section with a lot of saved time, as long as you decide to try one again :) 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1081751583

Cheers,
Jakub

author: {'steamid': '76561197970592387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1574196042}
review:
Got this on sale. Amazing bargain. Graphics beautiful.

Navigation hard work to start with. 

Pity you can't turn the helmet off. 

Better than lone echo in terms of feel and look.
developer_response:
Hi, 

Thanks for your review! Steering takes some time to master it, but in terms of the helmet, it's one of crucial things in the game's design. Being inside the helmet gives you a feeling that some part of the screen is almost stationary all the time. This helps to reduce motion sickness a bit, but as you have noticed, Detached is a game for players who need something more from VR.

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970415692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1561843959}
review:
Sorry - aber die Steuerung ist mit das schlechteste was ich bis jetzt in VR gesehen habe.
Habe es R√ºckerstattet lassen weil es so einfach nur Frust macht.
Seht euch Lieber "Lone Echo" an.....da will man gar nicht mehr weg davon
developer_response:
Hey,

We are sorry to hear that the controls made you decided to make a refund. In terms of steering, Lone Echo is quite different from out game, due to the fact that there are no hand gestures in Detached. For each controller, we've prepared several control schemes. I remind you that you can move in Detached at any axis, which requires a few minutes of training before the player can start comfortably exploring outer space.
I hope you will soon give the game one more chance!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052815929', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1560908882}
review:
Probably the most hardcore experience you can get out of your VR headset. 

Wanto make it out of shattered space station? You're in for a tough zero gravity ride, equipped with uncomfortable space suite, difficult controls (even on arcade mode) and then there are even enemies to boot you, save for all dangers that already await you in open space.

And prepare your stomach - this is that kind of VR game. Still an unforgettable experience. Who told you being an astronaut was an easy job?
developer_response:
Hi Tinefol!

Like you already noticed - being an astronaut it's not an easy job - we wanted to make the experience demanding, but also rewarding. I mean, look at these views!

Thank you for your honest feedback!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012800658', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1547708751}
review:
The Good

[list]
    [*]Sound design on point
    [*]The world is gorgeous
    [*]The feeling of solitude has never been more authentic.
[/list]
The Bad
[list]
    [*]Compared to other VR titles I've experienced, the controls are so horrendously unintutitive that game is unplayable.
    [*]Motion Sickness is almost inevitable with this title, regardless of how seasoned you are with VR.
[/list]
TL;DR 
If you're a fan of games like Descent and Sublevel Zero, this game may be for you.
If you are prone to motion sickness, do not buy this game.

Devs y'all could learn a thing or two from Lone Echo and Star Shelter movement systems.
Something as simple as adding a body to the player model can reduce motion sickness by a good amount.

Remember, this is just my opinion. If you're really wanting to try it, you can always refund if things don't work out.
developer_response:
Hi, 
thanks for your honest feedback. Really appreciate your effort to write this review. 

According to your cons, I would like to remind that we prepared few control schemes for each controller (Touch controllers, Gamepad, Keyboard). You can choose the best one, which can be more recognizable from FPS games or VR. Player can also enable steering assist or Eagle Eye View to limit field of view in the most nauseating moments (pitch, yaw, acceleration etc.). 

As you can see for example in the reviews, Detached is a kind of game, that will not suit everyone. We are aware that players with prone to motion sickness can have issues during the game, especially when the above mention features aren't enabled. Those who doesn't have any problems with nausea, simply enjoying the space exploration in zero-g.

As you wrote, there is always a possibility to make a refund if the game will be causing a motion sickness.

Thanks,
Jacob

author: {'steamid': '76561198003127468', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1626303293}
review:
I've just played it for a little while, but so far it feels awesome! Graphics are great, the atmosphere is pretty well achieved and the controls feels natural. The settings system helps the player to get the right amount of "realism" without getting to the point of feeling sickness. Yes... It can get a little fuzzy at first, but as you progress through the game you'll get to feel more and more comfortable (I guess it depends on each player, but it took me under halfe an hour to get up to "simulation" level without the hawk eye help - I DO recomend to start on "arcade" level, no matter how used you are to VR simulations).

If you're new to VR this should not be the first game you pick up. If you're an experienced player and you do like extreme experiences, then I'll say this is a must play for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001813417', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 850, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1541962799}
review:
Detached von Anshar Studios ist nun schon etwas ‚Äû√§lter‚Äú, und war grafisch und aufgrund der Steuerung sehr interessant, ist es immer noch so?

In dem gro√üartig aussehendem Detached spielen wir einem Astronauten, der unter gewissen Umst√§nden von seinem Raumschiff getrennt worden ist und nun nat√ºrlich alle m√∂glichen Systeme wieder zum Laufen bringen muss, um aus dieser verkorksten Situation wieder raus zu kommen. Detached ist ein Nullgravitationsspiel und so schweben wir w√§hrend des gesamten Spiels ohne Schwerkraft herum. Unsere VR-Brille wird sozusagen zu unserem Astronautenhelm. 
In einem Tutorial, bekommen wir ausf√ºhrlich erkl√§rt wie wir uns sicher in der Schwerelosigkeit bewegen. Es ist m√∂glich zu beschleunigen, aufzusteigen, abzusteigen und Drehungen in mehreren Achsen sind machbar. Je nach W√ºrgeschwelle des Spielers einstellbar. Die Bedienelemente bed√ºrfen einiger Gew√∂hnung, aber gemeistert vermitteln sie einen guten immersiven  Eindruck, wie man sich im All fortbewegen kann, denke ich ‚Äì ohne jetzt jemals im All gewesen zu sein ‚Ä¶
Einzig das Fehlen der H√§nde kann ich mal wieder nicht nachvollziehen, es werden nicht mal die Controller angezeigt. N√§hern wir uns einer Interaktion, wird ein Fenster eingeblendet, da√ü uns vorgibt, welchen Knopf wir am Controller zu dr√ºcken haben. Da h√§tte es zu Steigerung der Immersion beigetragen, wenn wir selber greifen, dr√ºcken oder ziehen k√∂nnten.

Die Meisterung der Steuerung ist allerdings  immens wichtig, den Detached ist im Groben ein Survivalspiel, in dem wir Sauerstoff- oder Treibstofftanks einsammeln m√ºssen, um nicht auf dem Weg zur Rettung auf der Strecke zu bleiben. Die Gebiete oder ‚ÄûLevel‚Äú sind ziemlich weitl√§ufig und wir haben schneller mit Sauerstoffmangel zu k√§mpfen, als uns lieb ist. Zudem gibt es keine Map oder √§hnliches, auch unsere Missionsziele sind nicht immer wirklich klar. Also verbringen wir unn√ºtz viel Zeit, indem wir suchend nach Hinweisen und R√§tseln herumschweben. So k√∂nnen wir aber wenigstens die fantastische Grafik bewundern, die diese Astronautensimulation uns bietet.
Frustrierend kann auch das Checkpoinsystem werden, denn Detached saved immer ab, wenn wir ein Raumschiffswrack betreten und wenn wir schon mit wenig Sauerstoff ankommen und dann dort auch nichts zu finden ist  haben wir schnell ein Problem und m√ºssen den Abschnitt neu starten. Sterben wir, kann es durch die Checkpointplatzierung auch passieren, da√ü wir immer wieder eine betr√§chtliche Menge Aufgaben neu erledigen m√ºssen. 

Trotzdem bietet Detached ein abwechslungsreiches Erlebnis, das Schweben im Raum ist atemberaubend, wenn man zum ersten mal aus einem der weit verstreuten Raumschiffe oder Abbaustationen schwebt. 
Die zu erledigen Aufgaben sind interessant und wir k√∂nnen auch Goodies wie ein Schild oder Raketen nutzen. Leider ist Detached aber im Singlespielermodus nicht sehr lang und der Multiplayer hat das selbe Problem wie alle MPVRSPiele, wenn sie keine shooter sind ‚Ä¶
Zudem ist Detached noch immer etwas teurer, obwohl schon √§lter, aber im Sale f√ºr Astronautensimfans ein Blick wert.

Mehr losgel√∂ste Reviews:
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32170554/

author: {'steamid': '76561197974522156', 'num_games_owned': 4394, 'num_reviews': 794, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1555835876}
review:
An awesome experience that I put off for far too long and when having the first play was upset that I had. Looks stunning in VR, the soundtrack is awesome. voicework controls all very well done. I surprised that there was not more of a  buzz about this game but glad I've found it now.

Video 5 minute review:
https://youtu.be/Vud19iGdZfg

Disclaimer: 
I have dozens of games I have to try in the limited VR time I have right now. So don't expect lots of hours as everytime I  get time in VR I have 3 to 4 games I have to try and video and review for a curator group. So don't get much time to return to great games, unfortunately. 

If you suffer VR sickness than maybe avoid this one, it has safeguards like vignette to try and help with VR sickness although it's probably not enough for those who suffer.

This was an awe-inspiring game in  VR for myself, I loved the soundtrack, the gameplay and the visuals it was a game where I just kept saying WOW to myself. As my recent review of StarShelter these two zero-g games are at the top of VR games for myself. Different games but both show the potential of VR in zero-g games and the immersion was deep in both.

I didn't find much wrong although maybe the repetitive voiceover from the AI instruction voice at times got too much. 
It's a great game and in my top ten VR games as of now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198862375832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1541729978}
review:
Il gioco in questione ha due facce della stessa medaglia molto diverse tra loro ed un lato oscuro con cui ci si far√† inevitabilmente i conti.
La prima faccia della medaglia √® dorata e di valore, sto parlando del comparto grafico, che rende questo titolo una delle pi√π belle esperienze in VR mai vissute da quando ho il visore, di quelle che ti segnano e ti mettono finalmente in mostra quante potenzialit√† abbia la realt√† virtuale. E' una meraviglia per gli occhi, √® immersione pura, √® un viaggio. Il comparto legato al movimento non trovo che sia cos√¨ difficile, √® inusuale e richiede pratica, tuttavia ci sono tre tipi di movimenti selezionabili nelle opzioni ed uno di questi risulta intuitivo, anche se un p√≤ macchinoso comunque.

La seconda faccia invece √® di ottone, cio√® quella legata al game play, infatti ci troveremo davanti ad enigmi devo dire poco esaltanti, a tratti noiosi ed altri ancora troppo incasinati da comprendere, portando il giocatore a dover fare i conti con il lato oscuro di cui parler√≤ tra poco, inoltre ci vorr√† poco a rendersi conto di quanto poco ossigeno e carburante ci sia in giro, trovandosi alle strette senza aver modo di trovarne e morendo cos√¨ poco dopo. Altro problema che non ho gradito √® che il gioco ha diverse volte deciso di salvarmi la partita a 10 secondi dalla morte per mancanza di ossigeno, ci√≤ ovviamente mi impossibilitava a trovarne altro e dovevo proprio ricaricare l'area. Sgradevole un bug cos√¨.

Ed ora il lato oscuro di cui parlavo all'inizio. Non ho mai sofferto di motion sickness in nessun gioco, ho sempre impostato movimenti e roteazione fluida in qualsivoglia titolo senza mai un problema. Il gioco ha tre modalit√†, arcade, simulazione ed astronaut. La prima ha movimenti lenti e semplificati, anche troppo ed √® giocabile, la seconda rende i movimenti molto difficili, √® difficile frenare, √® facile per questo motivo essere sbalzati lontani dalla destinazione, cosa anche gradevole perch√® porta maggior realismo alla mancanza di gravit√†, la terza invece rende i movimenti quasi ingestibili, quasi perch√® con un p√≤ di pratica si riesce ancora a controllare la navicella. La seconda e soprattutto la terza modalit√† per√≤ sono devastanti a livello di comfort VR, se ancora resisto alla modalit√† simulazione, alla modalit√† astronaut, persino io che non soffro di motion sickness, ho sensazioni di malessere sia in-game che per decine di minuti anche dopo che ho tolto il visore. Chi invece √® pi√π sensibile trover√†, sia nella modalit√† simulazione che astronaut, il pi√π intenso ed hardcore senso di malessere e nausea che probabilmente avr√† provato in tutta la sua "carriera" di giocatore VR. Non ho mai trovato prima d'ora un gioco cosi hardcore in termini di mancanza di confort in VR, proprio per via di questi movimenti ai limiti del gestibile, trovandosi a fluttuare, capovolgersi, essere sparati lontani, il tutto con grande difficolt√† a tornare in posizione consona.

In sintesi, gli metto un pollice in su per via dell'esperienza da effetto WOW del comparto grafico, che √® spettacolare, per il gameplay ed il comfort invece il pollice sarebbe verso. 
Valutate voi.
developer_response:
Thanks very much for your honest feedback. Much appreciated! 

The game was since the beginning designed to be much more difficult in terms of VR intense experiences, and we still try to inform players, that this game isn't suitable for everyone. Even that, we decided to add more comfort options to allow more sensitive players opportunity to try survive in space. But of course it's still challenging game.

Once again, thanks for taking your time to write the review.

review:
Looks and feels good.  It can be nauseating, but once you learn to really control your movement, you can mitigate the motion sickness.

I've only played about 1 hour, straight, in simulation mode, which does warn about motion sickness. I didn't get full-on sick but it definitely rumbles the tummy.

Do the tutorial. You will likely be uncomfortable and sick at the beginning but think of it as actual astronaut conditioning.  As you master the controls it will be less fatiguing.  Go slowly and deliberately.

The only complaint I [strike]have[/strike] had is the tunnel vision during rotation, which serves to reduce motion sickness.  I don't like it and wanted to remove or reduce the effect.  But it can be modified in the options, it's called "Eagle Eye View".

author: {'steamid': '76561197970945132', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1540955540}
review:
TLDR:  This is literally the first (and only) game I've ever refunded on Steam.  

I've got quite a bit of experience with VR.  I've got my "VR-legs" and don't really have any physical issues with games--even those that can be disorienting.  My system is spec'd pretty high--well beyond this game's minimum.

I wanted to like Detatched...I really did.  It looks like a title that I'd be into.  The graphics are solid, it's got a sci-fi theme, you're floating around in space.  And it is all those things, but boy it sure wasn't for me.  It really made me feel queasy.  I'm not talking a LITTLE queasy--I'm talking "this is NAUSEATING" queasy.

Look, I don't like knocking a title, and I don't lightly give anything a non-recommend.  This game does look nice and the gameplay elements I saw were okay--but the VR execution is just harsh.  Now, everyone is different, and if you're one of the folks who doesn't get sick in this game, then more power to you.  It might very well be a great game for those of you who aren't impacted.  It's just impossible for me to recommend because it almost seems purpose-built to make people sick.  There's even some bragging about it in the game trailer.  If you're on the fence with this title, my recommendation is to buy something else.  I certainly don't recommend picking it up at full price, and if you get it on sale (like I did) then just be prepared to have your money tied up for a few days while your refund is processed.
developer_response: Thanks for the review! I'm sorry you had such experience. It was, in fact, our intention to give a hardcore VR audience exactly such experience, and we don't recommend it to people who have any problems with acceleration in VR - because that is actually the only major rule we're breaking. We must communicate it better it seems for future projects, and we have absolutely no problem with people refunding if they have any issues. If you like space experience in VR we recommend Elite Dangerous, less nauseating, and still awesome:)

review:
6/10

I DO NOT RECOMMEND FOR --EVERYONE--

The game looks great. If I had a better PC, it would be able to look a lot better than "great."
Good game. 
Amazing concept and worthy of praise.

This game, as the video literally say, WILL MAKE YOU SICK. I've had VR for a while and don't normally get motion sickness. This game did a number on me when I set it to "Astronaut" mode. I do not dislike it because that. It warns customers, and it's a really great game at that.

WHY I DON'T RECOMMEND IT:
The helmet. The damned helmet. It feels like your head is a bubble 3 tims the size of what the helmet on the image looks like. It feels uncomfortable, potentially hard to get used to. The fact that moving your head moves the entire game with you is really, really bad (there may be an option to change this, hopefully, I am unsure). 

The other issue that really bugged me was that you can't rebind any of the keys. It would be much preferable if you were able to change what axes adjusted tilt, yaw, rotation, etc. 

Believe me when I say that this game is not for everyone. I would consider myself to have an above-average-consumer tolerence to VR motion sickness. If anything, get it mostly for the arcade mode (same game, just less nausiating).

author: {'steamid': '76561198096412999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1535769231}
review:
2 Minute Video Review ‚Üí https://youtu.be/GuKjm8Wc19E

Detached is a space exploration game with unique mechanics and impressive presentation.

You‚Äôre free flying inside space stations, and open space, looking for the rest of your crew. As you fly along you‚Äôll need to keep your eyes peeled for oxygen and fuel tanks to refill your system, and thankfully the easy difficulty lets those last a long time.

It feels like a puzzle game in some respects. You need to open airlocks, activate panels at the right time, etc...

Early on you‚Äôll gain three abilities that you absolutely must use: EMP rockets, a shield, and a speed boost. I think they implemented the need for a shield in especially creative ways: In one of the early puzzles you need to enter speed currents and break away glass to clear a path, after activating the current you‚Äôll hear a countdown to cue you activating the shield so you‚Äôre safe while you become the bullet to break the glass.

As you can probably tell from the footage, this game has completely free movement. You aim your direction with your left hand like a mouse pointer, and your right hand can turn where you face by tilting the controller in any direction. The freedom is great, but if you‚Äôre prone to motion sickness then I think you should take caution with this game.

The graphics, sound design, and music are outstanding. You feel truly alone and isolated in space, which may sound fun or give you anxiety, depending on how you‚Äôre wired. But if feeling alone in space while trying to solve puzzles sounds fun to you, then definitely check it out.
